main event: Three star-like objects were observed in the sky over Chalmette, Louisiana on August 8, 1958, moving at high speed in formation and able to stop in mid-air.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 5 hours,The objects were observed by civilian observers,No physical evidence was found,There were aircraft scrambled in the area but nothing was observed,The source of the sighting was considered unreliable.
sighted object: three star-like objects in the sky
witness description: civilian observers including family and neighbors
